content.text: Filters are used in power systems and in information technology systems where, despite normal application  of the general guidelines of installation and mitigating methods, disturbance levels exceed the immunity level

of the installed equipment. Filters are usually inserted into a circuit so that all intended circuit energy passes  through them enabling them to perform their function without impairing normal circuit operation.

Filters can have a two-fold effect by protecting the environment from disturbances generated within  equipment and also protect the equipment against disturbances generated externally to the equipment  concerned.
Each installation will be different and an individual study is necessary.
